intro: Uncinia compacta var. caespitiformis, commonly known as the tufted hookgrass, is a perennial grass species native to the western United States. It is characterized by its dense,丛生 growth habit, forming compact tufts or clumps. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open, disturbed habitats. Its botanical features make it an important component of native grassland ecosystems.
